page.title: 08Our Village-IN The Past.
page.content: Our village came into existence between 1856 and 1898.The 1898 map shows Esh Colliery,houses,and roads. We can see new things appearing such as Newhouse Church,Presbyterian Chapel,the Football Ground,Durham Road,Newhouse Road,a wagon way,a Sunday School,and Cornsay Colliery Railway. On the 1920 map Coronation Homes,Burnell Road,The Bungalows, Evenwood Road,Brandon Road,The Cricket Ground,and Picture Theatre are all new. On the 1939 map the Allotment Gardens,Cricket Pavilion,Newhouse Avenue,Tennis Courts,Hill View,and Fair View are all new. On the 1981 and 1983 maps we find that a lot of council houses have been built in the village and at Hamsteels.
